title: Cast Single Message Transform
description: Configuration schema for Cast transformation. Casts fields to different types (int8, int16, int32, int64, float32, float64, boolean, string).

type.description: The transformation type. Use 'org.apache.kafka.connect.transforms.Cast$Key' for key transformation or 'org.apache.kafka.connect.transforms.Cast$Value' for value transformation.
type.title: type

spec.description: Comma-separated list of field:type pairs. Example: 'field1:int8,field2:float64'
spec.title: spec

defaultSnippets.label: Cast - Convert fields to int32 and float64
defaultSnippets.description: Cast multiple fields in the record value to different types. Replace field1, field2 with your actual field names and adjust types as needed.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**Cast** multiple fields in the record value to different types.

Replace `field1`, `field2` with your actual field names and adjust types as needed.

**Supported types:** `int8`, `int16`, `int32`, `int64`, `float32`, `float64`, `boolean`, `string`

defaultSnippets.label: Cast - Convert key fields to string
defaultSnippets.description: Cast fields in the record key to string type. Replace 'id' with your actual key field name.
defaultSnippets.markdownDescription:
**Cast** fields in the record key to string type.

Replace `id` with your actual key field name.

**Note:** Use `Cast$Key` for key transformations and `Cast$Value` for value transformations.
